Test: m

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-01-07

Source: vignettes/tests/test.m.Rmd
test.m.Rmd
library(testthat)
library(ram)

Parameters

mux <- mum <- muy <- 100
deltam <- 28.5925808
deltay <- 14.4504452
alpha <- 0.7140742
tauprime <- 0.1414214
beta <- 0.7140742
alphabeta <- alpha * beta
sigma2x <- sigma2m <- sigma2y <- 225
sigma2epsilonm <- 110.2720609
sigma2epsilony <- 73.3220995
parameter_mu <- c(
  x = mux,
  m = mum,
  y = muy
)
parameter_m <- c(
  x = mux,
  m = deltam,
  y = deltay
)
parameter_A <- matrix(
  data = c(
    0,
    alpha,
    tauprime,
    0,
    0,
    beta,
    0,
    0,
    0
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
colnames(parameter_A) <- c("x", "m", "y")
rownames(parameter_A) <- c("x", "m", "y")
parameter_Omega <- matrix(
  data = c(
    sigma2x,
    0,
    0,
    0,
    sigma2epsilonm,
    0,
    0,
    0,
    sigma2epsilony
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
colnames(parameter_Omega) <- c("x", "m", "y")
rownames(parameter_Omega) <- c("x", "m", "y")
parameter_filter <- diag(nrow(parameter_A))
colnames(parameter_filter) <- c("x", "m", "y")
rownames(parameter_filter) <- c("x", "m", "y")
parameter_Sigma <- matrix(
  data = c(
    225,
    160.6667,
    146.5477,
    160.6667,
    225,
    183.3884,
    146.5477,
    183.3884,
    225
  ),
  ncol = 3
)

Let \(x\), \(m\), and \(y\) be observed variables whose associations are defined by

\[\begin{equation} y = 14.4504452 + 0.1414214 \cdot x + 0.7140742 \cdot m + \varepsilon_y \end{equation}\]

and

\[\begin{equation} m = 28.5925808 + 0.7140742 \cdot x + \varepsilon_m \end{equation}\]

where

\[\begin{equation} x \sim \mathcal{N} \left( 100, 225 \right) , \end{equation}\]

\[\begin{equation} \varepsilon_y \sim \mathcal{N} \left( 0, \sigma_{\varepsilon_{y}}^{2} = 73.3220995 \right) , \end{equation}\]

and

\[\begin{equation} \varepsilon_m \sim \mathcal{N} \left( 0, \sigma_{\varepsilon_{m}}^{2} = 110.2720609 \right) . \end{equation}\]

Column Vector of Means and Intercepts

\[\begin{equation} \mathbf{m} = \begin{bmatrix} 100 \\ 28.5925808 \\ 14.4504452 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}\]

Matrix of Regression Slopes

\[\begin{equation} \mathbf{A} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0.7140742 & 0 & 0 \\ 0.1414214 & 0.7140742 & 0 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}\]

Matrix of Variances

\[\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\Omega} = \begin{bmatrix} 225 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 110.2720609 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 73.3220995 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}\]

Filter Matrix

\[\begin{equation} \mathbf{F} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}\]

Model-Implied Variance-Covariance Matrix

\[\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\Sigma} \left( \boldsymbol{\theta} \right) = \begin{bmatrix} 225 & 160.6667 & 146.5477 \\ 160.6667 & 225 & 183.3884 \\ 146.5477 & 183.3884 & 225 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}\]

mutheta() 

result_m <- m(
  mutheta = parameter_mu,
  A = parameter_A,
  filter = parameter_filter
)

Column Vector of Means and Intercepts

\[\begin{equation} \mathbf{m} = \begin{bmatrix} 100 \\ 28.59258 \\ 14.45044 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}\]

testthat

test_that("M.", {
  for (i in seq_along(parameter_m)) {
    expect_equal(
      parameter_m[i],
      result_m[i, 1],
      check.attributes = FALSE,
      tolerance = 0.001
    )
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥‡
